, within the highlands west of The Great Rift Valley.
Kericho is known in Kenya for its tea fields, Unilever and other companies have large tea plantations around Kericho.
Kericho is well connected by road to

. Many buses and mini-buses (Matatus) leave Kericho every day. Matatus leave when they are full (the 14 seaters are usually filled with 17 people plus luggage and the drivers bribe the police at checkpoints, so try to get one of the two front seats as they are less stuffed) and that can be every few minutes of every hour, depending on how popular the destination.
Kisumu is a small town and can easily be walked. For the lazy, there are many motorbike taxis.

value: Two Indian temples of the large Indian minority in town (the descendents of the workers who constructed the Mombasa-Kisumu railroad for the British about a hundred years ago).
directions=Some two minutes walk from the Matatu Station
content=The small entrance from the street opens into a surprisingly large courtyard. Has clean rooms with mosquito nets and okay bathrooms.

There is a "Cyber" (Internet Cafe) next to Saigo Lodge, and some more Cybers all over town.
